reviews.review: I loved the game and recommend it with no hesitation.  Some of the plot points are confusing and I had to read an analysis of the ending in order to fully comprehend what I saw.  Also, searching suitcases and trashcans for health and salt gets annoying after the 1000th time.  But it's a beautiful world that should be explored for yourself.

UPDATE (Several Months after Playthrough):  
After going through the First Bioshock, I began to notice some flaws in this game. Bioshock infinite has a decent atmosphere and a lot of work was put in the environment. However, the genius of Bioshock 1 makes this game not as amazing as I originally thought. Bioshock 1 had the creepy atmosphere and the overall experience was better- I had an attachment to certain characters in the game. In Bioshock Infinite, Booker and Elizabeth are the only noteworthy characters...well besides Comstock. The story is not as relatable for some reason-not convincing? 

TLDR;

Pro: 
-Nice scenery
-Cool AI companion
-Stuff to explore

Con:
-Story not up to par to the first Bioshock game
-The game combat has not gotten better but arguably worse in some respects (Dishonored combat/ stealth system is superior)

OVERALL: 3.5/5 Stars (To compare : I would give the first Bioshock  a 4.5/5)


Initial Impression (Right after the Game):

An absolute marvel of storytelling that you will never forget. Bioshock Infinite is a must buy!

Bioshock Infinite tem a arte, design, todo o mundo lindo, espetacular e não estou falando apenas de gráficos, [i] que por sinal estão excelentes [/i], estou falando de toda a construção do mundo, dos detalhes, toda a escolha de cores, a Irrational Games esta de parabéns.

Sobre a trilha sonora, um jazz freqüente, músicas características para cada ambiente que você passa, com certeza te fazendo imergir num mundo diferente e às vezes te fazendo relembrar sucessos a muito não ouvidos.

Não tem como não se importar com a Elizabeth, a história digna da franquia é excelente, teve partes, uma hora ou outra que senti que se perdeu, mas seguiu seu caminho e se encontrou, te entregando um final nada mais do que fantástico.
Bioshock Infinite consegue ser o jogo que jogar uma vez não é suficiente para ver tudo, ou entender tudo, você descobre coisas que você nem imaginava e tem que voltar para ver de novo com seus próprios olhos.

Para quem gosta de um bom First Person Shooter com uma boa dose de exploração em um mundo de fantasia, com uma boa história e bons personagens, eu definitivamente recomendo Bioshock Infinite.

Was kann man dazu noch sagen. Wer sich ein paar Reviews bezüglich dieses Spieles angeschaut hat wird gemerkt haben, dass dieses Spiel die beste Bewertung dieses Jahr bekommen hat (2013)... und das auch nicht ohne Grund. 
Ein must-have!

Great visual scenarios (probably the best ever made so far), great achievement names, a few glitches that can be worked around. mind bending plot, loads of exciting conflicts.  A great game that kept me immersed.

I have too many problems with this game to organize a cohesive summary on why I think it's shit, so I'll just list some of the reasons it's terrible.

The gameplay is shallow, repetitive, and boring. The story is unnecessarily convoluted and gave me feels in an intrusive way that left me feeling violated. Some areas must be backtracked through 2 or even 3 times. Level design is lazy and makes the game feel cheap and arcade-like. Overall the game is far too easy, and the difficulty is increased late-game by throwing more enemies at you with more health - the definition of artificial difficulty. Maybe it's just me, but I don't enjoy listening to Elizabeth whining about her life while I backtrack to the next fight. Numerous unskippable interactive cutscenes do not belong in video games, and they absolutely destroy the pacing. If I want to watch a movie I will do just that.

At least the game is ogre now and I can uninstall it and embrace the regret of wasting $60 and ~8 hours of my time on this abomination.

dreck/10 would not recommend

Ok, so finally came around to complete this game.

Bioshock Infinite, created by the same people that made the first game,
the story takes place in a city in the skies, I won't explain much of the story
itself, most people already know the setting of this game.

In BioShock Infinite, you spend most of your time in the flying city Columbia.
It is an very well designed city, with alot of stuff going on there, and it feels like
a real city. The only downside is that it's not as open as I would have wished for.
There is side missions, and stuff to look for and extra places to visit, but the game
itself is pretty linear, so there is unfortunatly not much to explore of the city itself.
The side-missions, I do have a problem with. Most of them includes
backtracking, but the fustraiting part is that you don't really get a clear
indicator of where you have to go, or where the side-mission is, there's
no waypointer, or map location, you have to backtrack and blindly look for it.

The graphics in this game is good. It's very pretty in it's own style, Dx11 effects,
it bears the Bioshock style, but it COULD, have maybe been a tad better on some
areas, but still, the graphics are good.

The gameplay is fun, it has alot of action, and experimenting with all the different
"powers" you find through out the game, few weapon choises, well,
technically there are a fine number of weapons, but many of them are
"super" versions of each other.
The skyrails brings with it some fun tactical advantages you can use during
battles, and combining it with weapons and your "powers", it's a fast phased
fun gameplay.

The only complaint, is that when you die, you respawn, with
half health and with the same ammo you had when you died, so if you died with
no ammo, you'll respawn with little health and no ammo (or almost no ammo),
but the enemies you failed to kill before you died, will regain some health,
so if you died because you ran out of ammo,
you will respawn close to where you died, with little
health and no ammo, while the enemy has regained some health. So this brings
up some fustraiting situations which at times might seem like a paradox and
impossible to progress through.

The story of Infinite... Here I really can't say much, but the story
manages to capture your interest, it is one of the main
things making you want to see how it all ends and see the final conclution.
But there are some aspects of the story that, after you've completed, you'll
think "Why did I have to do that? What purpose do this serve?".
So some "side" stories that don't really have much to do with the main story
can feel like something put in there to make the game longer.

But the ending is a cluster fuck of plot twists and surprizes.
A true Bioshock ending. It is one of the most suprising endings
I have seen in a long time, and it's really worth playing this game
because of it.

But I do advice, the story of Bioshock Infinite do have alot of
elements from Quantum Physics/Mechanics, so if you really want
to understand the ending, go read up on Quantum mind fuck first.

Игра пройдена, за один день, честно, мне не понравилось, после первых двух частей это уже совсем не то. Неудобнаяя система боя на ПК, тупые враги, побеждающие не мозгами, а количеством, скучный геймплей. Но как не странно сюжет у этой игры очень хороший ( шёл только ради очередных кат-сцен ), отличные пейзажи летающего города. А так полная фигня, игры хватит только на один раз. Но даже с такими минусами и плюсами  эту игрушку всё-таки стоит попробовать.

Как человек, подсевший на серию Биошок, довольно долго ждал эту игру, и, честно говоря, конечный результат превзошел все мои ожидания раз этак в 10. В отличие от мрачного Восторга Колумбия выглядит просто...раем. Счастливые жители светлые улицы, праздник...но все не так уж и солнечно оказывается в летающем городе. Сюжет получился затягивающим, над дизайном уровней поработали просто выше всяких похвал, а концовка...это не описать словами) Думаю, разработчики заслужили денежку за свои труды, так что, друзья, не скупитесь, и поблагодарите людей за безупречно проделанную работу.
P.S. Элизабет няшка х)

A truly brilliant game that combines story and combat neatly into one form. It's interactions with the environment and using it in your combat is truly exciting. I would recommend this game to anyone who wishes to find a form of entertainment that both rewards a casual player and the curious and strategic player. Truly a game that earns its stars.

Deep story, interesting characters, decent combat and tons of exploring. Currently the best in the Bioshock serries. Is there a reason NOT to get this game?

The creators of Bioshock, including Ken Levine himself, have outdone themselves. This game is mesmerizing. Playing through it, I got the same feelings I got playing through the original Bioshock. I wanted to explore this world and find out what was going on before I got there and what was going to happen now. It is an entirely new and interesting world. I dropped everything to play this game because I was so into it. You acquire a companion in this game in the NPC, Elizabeth, whose face is beautifully rendered to tell stories that words simply can't. She feels very much like she is a part of this world and is a living, breathing character rather than an AI. Her implementation as a partner was extremely well done. The only possible negatives I can mention are the fact that, unlike the previous games, you can only carry 2 guns at a time which limits your combat choices and there are the occasional oddities like NPCs disappearing or the inability to interact with them, instead just listening in on conversations. These issues, though, are miniscule and should not deter anyone in the game. The PC port is very well done this time which is terrific. This is a must-play for anybody and everybody. 9.5/10

If you've come from the very first Bioshock, you'll feel this mostly as an upgrade. But all newcomers will be greeted with one of the most intense FPS experiences. Immserse in the deep ambience of Columbia, a masterfully crafted world where social and religious differences will lead to turmoil, and trapped in the middle of this struggle, you'll lose yourself in the universe of posibilities driven by a very dramatic storyline. With a very dynamic gameplay, memorable characters and a world that will ensnare you into it, Bioshock Infinite delivers big time, even if the title barely has anything to do with the game.
great game

BioShock is a tough act to follow, and this does so better than I could ever have imagined. A vibrant, fully-realized world complements exciting, entertaining gameplay and a multi-layered plot that will move and enthrall you to the very end. 

This is a game that everyone should experience, and I promise that the only thing you'll want to do when you finish is dive back in and relive it.

Pro's: Terrific graphics and visuals even for the dated ut3 engine, Amazing story that sucks you right in and does not let go! And for once a companion that takes care of herself and give's you aid when you need it the most.

Con's: Game is horribly unbalanced, Never get enough money for tonics or upgrades, And difficulty is WAY to easy, even for a first person shooter, 1999 mode feels like medium difficulty,

Final Verdict: Hopefully there will be a patch in the future that balances the game a little bit, But don't let the con's stop you from playing the best FPS since Half-Life 2.

After the Masterpiece which was Bioshock One the bar has been set pretty high for Infinite. Production Values are up there but I can´t help it feeling slightly dissapointed about the ending. Эта игра является произведением искусства, с самого своего начала ты не можешь оторваться от той красоты которая предстаёт перед тобой. Не смотря на давольно мультяшную графику к внешнему виду придирок нет. Как шутер игра  интересна только в тех случаях когда у теб появляется новое оружие или новая способность, но тем немение игра редка даёт тебе скучать подкидывая новую пачку врагов. Разнообразие оружия не особо много, но к концуигры уже вполне определяешься со воим любимым стволом и ходишь только с ним. Способности в игре интересные но ими пользуешься давольно редко. Так например самая первая способность дающая контроль над техникой врага действительно нужна только при получении её, в дальнейшем про неёможно спокойно забыть и не вспоминать. Что касается сюжета - захватывающе и интересно, но чем дальше тем всё более запутано, и под самый конец сы уже мало что можешь понять, но посление слова во всеё игре всё разруливают и у тебя буквально начинается мозговой штурм, ты начинаешь проводить логические цепочки от одной непонятки к другой складывая их в единое целое и врезультате ты понимаешь на сколько глубоким и интересным был сюжет.

What can I say that hasn't been said already? Maybe I should just explain a small aspect of my own personal experience with it.....
My wife enjoyed watching me play this game so she had just as much invested in it, and was there with me as the story unfolded and we learned the tale of Booker Dewitt and the somewhat convoluted story of Elizabeth.
The night I finished the game when I took my hands off the keyboard (knowing of course that this was the moment after the big final epic battle) we both just sat there in stunned silence as the game concluded itself.
When the credits had finished rolling and the last tidbit of end-game material was gone, we still just sat there, silent, for at least 3-5 mins staring at the title screen and trying to absorb what we had just been witness to.
We then sat up the rest up the evening talking about every aspect of what had played out and what we had done to get there.
This game really changed the way I think about what story-telling in video games should mean.
This also was one of the rare instances of when I felt that the pro reviewers and journalists were totally justified in handing out 10/10 scores for a game.
It was perfect in almost every way.

This is one of the most amazing games I have ever played. The plot is 85% character development, 10% combat, and 5% exploration. The graphics are stunning and gorgeous; I've noticed a few aspects in this game from Dishonoured, and that's not necessarily bad. It's great, in fact. Well, I don't want to spoil ANY part of the story. It's one of those games where the game is so fantastic that the story is too good to be spoiled. You have to find out for yourself! Get this game!!!! Have fun and enjoy!

This game has astonishing and smart storyline. It is amazing how player gets to interact with it on almost every step, involvement and atmosphere are strong, so you actually feel and live this story through by yourself. There are couple drastic plot holes, but the fact its quite complex and wide - makes that issue hardly noticeable or just ignorable in general.
Gameplay is kind of a let down. It not that bad, but its just a trivial shooter. There are no tactical aspects involved during battles. Developers added many interesting combat features, but did not any motivation to use those other than "for fun". There are no any sort of puzzles and all easter eggs (side missions) are quite boring (just running back and forth, searching every corner). All that makes gameplay linear and repetitive at a times.

9/10 - A "must play" for a whole new experience that hardly any game can offer.
What's not to love about a city in the sky filled with racists, religious fanatics, and mechanical bird-monsters.

Catch this review Booker! 
The problem with squeals to big name games like BioShock, is that it has to deal with the hype train. It has to get on the track, wait for the train to gain speed, and stare it down, until the inevitable, either the train wrecks the game, or the game wrecks the train. BioShock Infinite is one of the few games that destroys the train, leaving nothing behind except lumps of metal and coal. 'What makes this game so great?' you ask, while I can't put it in good enough words to meet the praise that BioShock Infinite deserves, I will do my best. We will go through the list just like other games. Originality, story, and game play. Now for me the game is original in it's setting, it's in a amazing world, not too many games have done floating city (I don't think) and from what I can tell, this game did it right. While I never have beaten BioShock, I always got the feeling of being confined, trapped, and above all, alone (splicers don't count), this was an amazing combination for a city dystopia underwater. So what about when you're in the air, a place where you're the most free? Well, you need the exact opposite, you need to feel free, and you should feel like you're not alone (although this one might not be needed, I feel like it should be done), that you have people that you can count on. The later is done with the meeting of Elizabeth, your companion on the adventure ahead, she's more or less always with you, filling the gap that would be there if you were a one man death machine (don't worry, you still are), granted, she does nothing in combat (almost) but none the less, you have someone, she'll be there when you accidentally blow up that oil drum next to you, or when you thought that you could kill everyone with that pistol you've had since the beginning of the game, point is, she'll be there every time you die. Now for the freedom, many might disagree with me, but I say that Infinite did a good job on this, I'll discuss the story more later, but in the end you're on a one way road, but never have I felt that road be, ironically enough, open (As well as closed, if you play the game you'll know what I mean). I'll tie up combat mechanics and originality right here, sky hooks, and sky lines are an incredibly small and simple thing, but it does an incredible job on letting you move freely in the battle field. You're given so many small options that you don't really think they're a big deal, but in reality, they're one of the most important things. Do I get on a rail, and head for a vantage point to snipe my enemies? Or do i use the rail as a means to attack, or do you use your amazing vigors to set your enemies on fire while they're eaten alive by a murder? Or hey, why not do all three? The use of skylines and sky hooks allows you to even attack flying blimps that move around freely on the map, you jump onto them and you remember "Hey! I'm thousands of feet high above the ground, let me throw you into the air, and shoot you off your boat!". Or maybe I was the only cruel one? *Cough*. Anyways, the game did a good job on making me feel like I had choices, when in fact, I was going down the "same" road as everyone else. Which I think, did wonders for the final parts of the story. *I felt free, until the ending anyways* 
"Yeah screw originality, how about story?" The story is great, I likeed seeing the progression of Elizabeth and Booker throughout the story, but other than that I won't get into it because it's something that you've gotta experience yourself, but I will say this. The beginning of the game you feel free, unbound, the city is a utopia for you to blow things up in, but.. let's just say that you'll start to see the real colors of the city when you get into it. Red.
"Okay... what's the game play like?" It's solid.

Irrational Games' early work with the original "Bioshock" was a little too dark for my tastes, but when "Bioshock Infinite" came out in '13, I think they really came into their own, commercially and artistically. The whole game has a clear, crisp progression, and a new sheen of consummate professionalism that really gives the story a big boost. The series has been compared to the "Gears of War" franchise, but I think Irrational has a far more bitter, cynical sense of humor. 

All in all, a great, great game; a personal favorite.
It is INFINITE!
Excellent story and all around great game.
Good Game!!!

Incredible story, voice-acting, and an immersive world are what this game has to offer. Gun-play may not be the best, but the journey is more than worth it. The characters and the world are top-notch! You don't just play Bioshock Infinite, you experience it!
Hands down one of the best games I have ever played. Unbelievable from start to finish and, just, incredible.

A swashbuckling adventure that raises the bar on First Person Shooters that have RPG elements. An amusing story, combat that doesn't get boring and the jump button isn't for peaking over the gap in the high wall, it's also for getting around during battle. (for reasons that become clear in-game)

For a game where you go around a city in the sky killing racists, THIS is the best i've encountered so far.

I played this game when it came out and years later, every now and then I'll think "Oh yeah, Bioshock Infinite. That was a thing." Then I look at the Metacritic score of 94 and do a double take. It does some stuff really well but never delivers on it's full potential. The setting begs for an expanded open world but the game itself is disappointingly small in scope. Story is decent, at the time it came out it was widely praised. It  hasn't aged as well as the original Bioshock because of it's linear design and increased focus on gunplay instead of expanding the roleplaying and open world elements of Bioshock. That being said it's a fun game and can be bought for cheap these days.
this game is the shit

Главное разочарование года. Игра вообще не оправдала ожиданий. Плохая шутерная часть, унылый сеттинг, однообразный дизайн локаций с картонными летающими домиками, корявая графика с завышенными требованиями, кроме Элизабет больше нет вразумительных персонажей, обычный и заурядный сюжет, кто бы что ни говорил. Еле заставил себя пройти до конца.
